thread.title: Stacey Solomon 'feels too guilty to have kids with Joe Swash' because she doesn't want her children to have different fathers
thread.title_full: Stacey Solomon 'feels too guilty to have kids with Joe Swash' because she doesn't want her children to have different fathers

author: Vicki Newman
title: Stacey Solomon 'feels too guilty to have kids with Joe Swash' because she doesn't want her children to have different fathers
text:
Stacey Solomon 'feels too guilty to have kids with Joe Swash' because she doesn't want her children to have different fathers The star says it's a "difficult dynamic" when some kids live with their fathers and others don't Share Stacey Solomon reveals that she may never have kids with Joe Swash (Photo: Lia Toby/WENN.com) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash may never have children as she's worried about her children having different fathers. 
The former X Factor star already has two sons, eight-year-old Zachary with childhood sweetheart Dean Cox and Leighton, four, with ex-fianc√© Aaron Barnham. 
But the singer and TV presenter, 27, says things can become "difficult" if some children live with their father and others don't. 
She's worried that if she had a child with Joe , her other sons would feel left out. Read More Stacey Solomon confesses her sexual fantasies and says she hopes boyfriend Joe Swash is just as kinky Stacey and Joe may never have kids (Photo: ITV) 
Stacey told Star magazine: "You worry about, 'If the father of my next child lives with me, do the other kids then feel bad about being left out?' It's a difficult dynamic." 
The former Queen of the Jungle says she doesn't worry about how other people view her, but about how things will affect her kids. 
She said: "A lot of people make you feel bad about having different children to different people. It doesn't seem that bad, but it's hard for people to digest and they think it's unfair on the kids." 
It could mean that Stacey and Joe, who hosted I'm A Celeb spin-off Extra Camp together, may never have a child together. 
She added: "We talk about it. But briefly. Joe's got his boy and I've got mine. The boys love Joe. It's just doing what's right for the children rather than we we selfishly want."
